oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Outbuildings; Flagpoles
Education; Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front exterior of the Spann Rosenwald School. It has two entry/exit doors and several glass-pane windows. There is an outbuilding in the side yard. Both buildings are constructed of wood frame.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Education Schoolhouse Photos, 1938-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Spann Rosenwald School had two rooms, two teachers, and seventy-one students. The school was noted for its drinking fountain, garden, and its "Well Planned Patriotic Program."
